unnormalised: New Delhi – Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) is examining recent changes in data plan pricing by major providers like Airtel and Jio. Concerns are rising among consumers, particularly in Tier-2 cities like Kanpur and Patna, regarding the affordability of 4G data.
normalised: New Delhi – Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (T R A I) is examining recent changes in data plan pricing by major providers like Airtel and Jio. Concerns are rising among consumers, particularly in Tier two cities like Kanpur and Patna, regarding the affordability of four G data.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, a telecom analyst at IIT-Delhi, notes that the base data plan prices have seen an increase of approximately 15% in the last quarter. "This increase impacts low-income households significantly," he stated.
normalised: Doctor Sharma, a telecom analyst at I I T-Delhi, notes that the base data plan prices have seen an increase of approximately fifteen percent in the last quarter. "This increase impacts low-income households significantly," he stated.

unnormalised: A survey conducted by the Consumer Rights Protection Forum (CRPF) shows that nearly 60% of respondents in Mumbai are considering downgrading their data usage due to the rising costs. Many are switching to Wi-Fi hotspots, especially in areas with robust network coverage like Cyber Hub, Gurugram.
normalised: A survey conducted by the Consumer Rights Protection Forum (C R P F) shows that nearly sixty percent of respondents in Mumbai are considering downgrading their data usage due to the rising costs. Many are switching to Wi-Fi hotspots, especially in areas with robust network coverage like Cyber Hub, Gurugram.

unnormalised: Reliance Jio, however, maintains that its plans remain competitive, offering up to 2GB of data per day for Rs. 249. Critics point out that these plans often come with hidden conditions, such as reduced speeds after a certain data threshold. The new plans are being reviewed for compliance within the defined sq ft of usage. Further TRAI review is expected before Diwali.
normalised: Reliance Jio, however, maintains that its plans remain competitive, offering up to two G B of data per day for rupee two hundred and forty nine. Critics point out that these plans often come with hidden conditions, such as reduced speeds after a certain data threshold. The new plans are being reviewed for compliance within the defined square feet of usage. Further T R A I review is expected before Diwali.
